1.description: Thirteen-year-old wizard spending another miserable summer at the Dursleys. Learning about escaped prisoner Sirius Black.

2.description: Accidentally inflated Aunt Marge and fled Privet Drive in anger. Picked up by the Knight Bus.

5.description: Faints when Dementors board the Hogwarts Express. Saved by Professor Lupin who teaches him about the creatures.

9.description: Begins taking private lessons with Professor Lupin to learn the Patronus Charm. Still faints around Dementors.

12.description: Learns that Sirius Black was his father's best friend and supposedly betrayed his parents to Voldemort.

17.description: Discovers Peter Pettigrew is alive and that Sirius is innocent. Saves Sirius from the Dementors' kiss.

21.description: Uses the Time-Turner to save Buckbeak and Sirius. Successfully casts a full Patronus to save his past self.

5.description: Third-year student taking an unusually heavy course load. Seems to be everywhere at once.

16.description: Punches Draco Malfoy and walks out of Divination class. Shows unusual knowledge of magical creatures.

21.description: Revealed to have been using a Time-Turner all year to attend multiple classes. Helps Harry save Sirius and Buckbeak.

4.description: Harry's best friend, now in his third year. His rat Scabbers seems ill and keeps trying to hide.

15.description: Scabbers has disappeared. Ron blames Hermione's cat and their friendship is strained.

17.description: Learns that his rat Scabbers was actually Peter Pettigrew in Animagus form. Feels betrayed and disgusted.

1.description: Dangerous wizard who escaped from Azkaban prison. First wizard ever to break out of the supposedly escape-proof prison.

12.description: Revealed to have been James Potter's best friend and Harry's godfather. Accused of betraying the Potters to Voldemort.

17.description: Confronts Harry in the Shrieking Shack. Claims to have important information about that night twelve years ago.

18.description: Revealed to be innocent - was framed by Peter Pettigrew. Has been hunting Pettigrew as Scabbers to protect Harry.

21.description: Escaped on Buckbeak after being saved by Harry and Hermione. Still a fugitive but free to help Harry from hiding.

5.description: New Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher. Shabby but kind wizard who saves Harry from the Dementors.

8.description: Excellent teacher who makes Defence classes practical and engaging. Students love his lessons after years of poor teaching.

18.description: Revealed to be a werewolf. Transforms under the full moon and nearly attacks Harry, Hermione, and Sirius.

22.description: Resigns from Hogwarts after Snape reveals his werewolf identity. Returns Harry's Invisibility Cloak and the Marauder's Map.

4.description: Ron's pet rat who seems sickly and nervous. Has been with the Weasley family for twelve years.

18.description: Revealed to be an Animagus who has been hiding as Ron's rat Scabbers. Actually the wizard who betrayed Harry's parents to Voldemort and framed Sirius.

19.description: Escapes when Lupin transforms into a werewolf. Returns to serve Voldemort after twelve years in hiding.

6.description: Gamekeeper and teacher of Care of Magical Creatures. Introduces the class to Buckbeak the hippogriff.

7.description: Worried about Buckbeak after Draco's injury. Fears what the Ministry might do to his beloved creature.

20.description: Devastated when Buckbeak is sentenced to death. Drinks heavily as the execution approaches.

8.description: Still the unpleasant Potions Master. Clearly dislikes the new Defence teacher, Professor Lupin.

17.description: Arrives at the Shrieking Shack and tries to arrest Sirius. Reveals deep hatred for the Marauders from their school days.

22.description: Reveals Lupin's werewolf identity to the school, forcing Lupin's resignation. Takes satisfaction in his revenge.

4.description: Hogwarts Headmaster concerned about the Dementors stationed at school. Trusts his teachers completely.

21.description: Suggests that Harry and Hermione can save more than one innocent life by using time wisely.

5.description: Hooded, soul-sucking creatures guarding Hogwarts to catch Sirius Black. Drain happiness and hope from people nearby.

9.description: Can only be repelled by the Patronus Charm. Feed on happy memories and positive emotions.

20.description: Perform the Dementor's Kiss - sucking out a person's soul, leaving them an empty shell.

6.description: Magnificent hippogriff with the head and wings of an eagle and body of a horse. Very proud creature that demands respect.

7.description: Attacks Draco Malfoy after Draco insults him. Draco claims to be badly injured.

20.description: Sentenced to death by the Committee for Disposal of Dangerous Creatures. Awaits execution.

21.description: Rescued by Harry and Hermione using the Time-Turner. Flies Sirius to freedom.

6.description: Third-year Slytherin student. Shows off and insults Buckbeak during Hagrid's first class.

7.description: Claims to be seriously injured by Buckbeak. Milks the injury for sympathy and attention.

16.description: Punched in the face by Hermione Granger. Cowardly runs away from the confrontation.

3.description: Minister for Magic who meets Harry at the Leaky Cauldron. Concerned about Harry's safety from Sirius Black.

20.description: Arrives at Hogwarts with the Dementor to perform the Kiss on Sirius Black. Refuses to believe in Black's innocence.

6.description: New Divination teacher with huge glasses and many shawls. Predicts death and doom dramatically but seems like a fraud.

16.description: Hermione walks out of her class, calling Divination rubbish. Trelawney is offended by the dismissal.

17.description: Makes a genuine prophecy about the servant returning to his master. Doesn't remember making the prediction.

7.description: Third-year Gryffindor who is terrified of Professor Snape. Performs better in other classes.

8.description: Successfully faces a boggart that takes the form of Snape. Gains confidence from Professor Lupin's teaching.

2.description: Conductor of the Knight Bus, around eighteen years old with protruding ears. Chats with Harry about Sirius Black.
Elderly driver of the Knight Bus with thick glasses. Takes the bus on wild journeys through London streets.

3.description: Toothless innkeeper of the Leaky Cauldron who welcomes Harry. Concerned about his safety from Sirius Black.

4.description: Transfiguration professor and Head of Gryffindor House. Strict but caring teacher who worries about student safety.

21.description: Entrusted Hermione with the Time-Turner to take extra classes. Shows great trust in her responsibility.

9.description: Seventh-year Gryffindor Quidditch Captain and Keeper. Obsessed with winning the Quidditch Cup in his final year.

11.description: Fifth-year Gryffindor twin who gives Harry the Marauder's Map. One of the Gryffindor Beaters on the Quidditch team.
Fifth-year Gryffindor twin who helps give Harry the Marauder's Map. Other Gryffindor Beater alongside his twin.

4.description: Seventh-year Gryffindor and Head Boy. Very ambitious and rule-following, takes his prefect duties seriously.
Second-year Gryffindor and Ron's younger sister. Shy around Harry but brave and determined.

5.description: Third-year Gryffindor student and Harry's dormmate. Irish accent and tendency to cause small explosions in class.
Third-year Gryffindor student and Harry's dormmate. Interested in football and gets along well with everyone.

6.description: Third-year Gryffindor student who takes Divination. Very interested in Professor Trelawney's predictions.
Third-year Gryffindor student who takes Divination. Very supportive of Professor Trelawney's methods.

13.description: Fifth-year Gryffindor and Quidditch commentator. Friend of the Weasley twins and enthusiastic announcer.
Fifth-year Gryffindor Chaser on the Quidditch team. Reliable player who works well with the other Chasers.
Fifth-year Gryffindor Chaser on the Quidditch team. Fast and agile player who scores consistently.
Fifth-year Gryffindor Chaser on the Quidditch team. Tall and skilled player with natural leadership qualities.
Slytherin Quidditch Captain and Chaser. Aggressive player who leads the Slytherin team with intimidation tactics.
Hufflepuff Seeker and Captain. Handsome, popular sixth-year who plays fair and is well-liked by most students.
Ravenclaw Seeker and fourth-year student. Pretty and skilled Quidditch player who catches Harry's attention.

7.description: Hogwarts matron who runs the hospital wing. Fussy but caring, treats Draco after his encounter with Buckbeak.

4.description: Hogwarts caretaker who patrols the corridors with his cat Mrs. Norris. Grumpy and eager to punish students.
Filch's mangy grey cat who helps patrol Hogwarts corridors. Seems to understand human speech and reports to Filch.
Hermione's new pet - a large, ginger, half-kneazle cat with a squashed face. Very intelligent and suspicious of Scabbers.

17.description: Revealed to have been helping Sirius Black, recognizing him as innocent. Part-kneazle intelligence allowed him to detect Pettigrew.

10.description: Landlady of the Three Broomsticks in Hogsmeade. Pretty, curvy witch who serves butterbeer to students and locals.

16.description: Draco's father and wealthy member of Hogwarts Board of Governors. Uses his influence to push for Buckbeak's execution.

20.description: Hooded Ministry official who arrives to execute Buckbeak. Carries a large axe and follows Ministry orders without question.

4.description: Portrait who guards the entrance to Gryffindor Tower. Likes to sing opera and requires the password to enter.

13.description: Found slashed and hiding after Sirius Black attacked her portrait trying to enter Gryffindor Tower.

6.description: Portrait of a knight with a fat pony who challenges people to duels. Brave but incompetent medieval knight.

13.description: Temporarily replaces the Fat Lady as password keeper. Changes passwords frequently and lets Sirius in by accident.

4.description: Mischievous poltergeist who haunts Hogwarts. Causes chaos and mayhem, dropping things on students and making messes.
Gryffindor House ghost whose head is nearly severed. Friendly ghost who welcomes students back to school.
Herbology professor and Head of Hufflepuff House. Kindly witch who teaches students about magical plants.
Tiny Charms professor and Head of Ravenclaw House. Excitable teacher who demonstrates spells with enthusiasm.

2.description: Vernon's sister who breeds bulldogs. Nasty woman who insults Harry's parents, causing Harry to accidentally inflate her.
Aunt Marge's favorite bulldog who once attacked Harry. Aggressive dog that reflects his owner's nasty temperament.

1.description: Harry's uncle and guardian. Large, beefy man who works at a drill company and despises anything magical.
Harry's aunt and Lily's sister. Thin, horse-faced woman who resents Harry and tries to suppress his magical nature.
Harry's spoiled cousin who bullies him regularly. Large, stupid boy who is pampered by his parents.

9.description: Harry's deceased father, revealed to have been friends with Professor Lupin at school.

12.description: James Potter was best friends with Sirius Black and trusted him as his Secret-Keeper.

17.description: One of the four Marauders who created the Marauder's Map. His Animagus form was a stag.

12.description: Harry's mother, murdered by Voldemort after being betrayed by someone they trusted.

3.description: Jamaican shrunken head that announces Knight Bus stops and destinations.
Ministry official assigned to protect Minister Fudge during his meeting with Harry.

5.description: The lead Dementor that boards the Hogwarts Express, particularly drawn to Harry.

6.description: Another hippogriff in Hagrid's Care of Magical Creatures class, less prominent than Buckbeak.

13.description: Slytherin Chaser who plays against Gryffindor in Quidditch matches.
Slytherin Chaser and team member, known for aggressive playing style.
One of the Slytherin Beaters, notorious for rough play during matches.
Slytherin Beater partnered with Bole, known for intimidation tactics.
Hufflepuff team's Keeper who plays against Harry's team.
One of Hufflepuff's Beaters who plays in the match against Gryffindor.
Second Hufflepuff Beater working with his partner during Quidditch matches.
Ravenclaw team's Keeper who defends their goalposts during matches.
One of three Ravenclaw Chasers who score goals for their team.
Second Ravenclaw Chaser contributing to the team's scoring efforts.

20.description: Ministry official assisting the executioner with Buckbeak's scheduled execution.

16.description: Head of the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures who sentences Buckbeak.

3.description: Dangerous Death Eater and Sirius Black's cousin, mentioned as another notorious Azkaban prisoner.

10.description: Owner of Zonko's Joke Shop in Hogsmeade, popular with Hogwarts students.
Owner of Honeydukes sweet shop in Hogsmeade, sells magical confections.
Co-owner of Honeydukes with her husband, helps run the popular sweet shop.

8.description: Previous Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher, mentioned as having left the position vacant for Lupin.

6.description: Sir Cadogan's loyal but cowardly pony that appears with him in his portrait.

4.description: Slytherin House ghost covered in silver bloodstains, the only being Peeves fears.
Ravenclaw House ghost, tall and beautiful but distant and aloof.
Hufflepuff House ghost, jolly and kind-hearted friar who welcomes students warmly.

5.description: Ravenclaw third-year student in Harry's year, intelligent and studious.
Ravenclaw third-year student, known for his quick wit and academic prowess.
Ravenclaw third-year student who shares classes with Harry and his friends.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year, quiet but observant member of his house.
Hufflepuff third-year student, pompous but well-meaning and loyal to his friends.
Hufflepuff third-year student, pink-faced and kind-hearted girl who is easily flustered.
Hufflepuff third-year student with red hair, niece of Amelia Bones from the Ministry.
Hufflepuff third-year student from a wealthy Muggle family, well-spoken and friendly.
Slytherin third-year student, quiet and solitary member of Draco's year.
Slytherin third-year student with a pug-like face, devoted follower of Draco Malfoy.

4.description: Large, stupid Slytherin student who serves as one of Draco Malfoy's bodyguards.
Large, dim-witted Slytherin student who acts as Draco Malfoy's other bodyguard.

1.description: Nosy neighbor of the Dursleys who gossips about the family's business.

9.description: Dark magical creatures mentioned in Defence Against the Dark Arts lessons - reanimated corpses.

8.description: Shape-shifting creature that takes the form of whatever a person fears most, used in Lupin's classes.

6.description: One of the four founders of Hogwarts, mentioned in relation to Slytherin House traditions.
Founder of Gryffindor House, mentioned in relation to house history and values.

3.description: Senior Auror mentioned in connection with the search for Sirius Black.

7.description: Magical healer mentioned in connection with treating serious magical injuries.

3.description: Owner of an ice cream parlor in Diagon Alley who serves Harry during his stay at the Leaky Cauldron.

5.description: Ghost professor who teaches History of Magic in the most boring way possible.

8.description: Hogwarts librarian who guards the library books with extreme vigilance and suspicion.

21.description: Harry's Patronus that takes the form of a stag, the same as his father James Potter's Animagus form.

3.description: Head administrator of Azkaban prison, responsible for overseeing the Dementor guards.

1.description: Radio journalist reporting on Sirius Black's escape and the Ministry's response.

10.description: One of the many owls used for mail delivery at the Hogsmeade post office.

8.description: Former Malfoy house-elf, now free, mentioned by students discussing house-elf rights.

11.description: One of the many house-elves working in Hogwarts kitchens to prepare meals.

1.description: Harry's loyal snowy owl who delivers his mail and provides companionship.

22.description: Tiny hyperactive owl given to Ron to replace Scabbers, much to Ron's mixed feelings.

1.description: Daily Prophet reporter mentioned in connection with sensational stories about Sirius Black's escape.

6.description: One of many knight portraits throughout Hogwarts who challenge students to duels.

4.description: One of the many portrait ladies throughout Hogwarts who gossip and observe student activities.

5.description: Large Slytherin third-year girl, aggressive and unpleasant like most of her housemates.
Slytherin third-year student, quieter than most of her housemates but still pure-blood supremacist.
Second-year Gryffindor who idolizes Harry Potter and constantly takes photographs.
Colin's younger brother, also a Gryffindor who admires Harry greatly.

11.description: Mentioned as a former Gryffindor student and father of current student.

3.description: Wandmaker in Diagon Alley, remembers every wand he's ever sold including Harry's.
Owner of Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions, outfits Hogwarts students.
One of the goblin tellers at Gringotts Bank who handles wizarding currency.
Suspicious wizard lurking in Knockturn Alley, dealing in dark magical items.

4.description: Massive squid living in the Hogwarts lake, generally peaceful but impressive.

5.description: Magical creatures mentioned in Care of Magical Creatures class, visible only to those who've seen death.

3.description: Auror involved in the hunt for Sirius Black, competent but not exceptional.

20.description: Low-level Ministry employee handling paperwork for the Committee hearing.

8.description: Legendary wizard mentioned in classes, considered the greatest wizard of all time.

4.description: Portrait of a lady in a violet dress who gossips with other portraits about student activities.

6.description: Hagrid's large boarhound, cowardly despite his intimidating size.

13.description: Flying instructor and Quidditch referee with hawk-yellow eyes and grey hair.

3.description: Owner of the Quidditch supply shop in Diagon Alley, knowledgeable about flying equipment.

8.description: Aggressive water creatures mentioned in Defense Against the Dark Arts lessons.
Japanese water creature discussed in Defense Against the Dark Arts class.

11.description: Head house-elf in charge of Hogwarts kitchen operations and meal preparation.

7.description: Teaching skeleton in the hospital wing used by Madam Pomfrey for medical instruction.

4.description: Professor McGonagall's Animagus form as a tabby cat, occasionally seen around grounds.

1.description: Editor of the Daily Prophet who oversees coverage of Sirius Black's escape.
One of the other dangerous prisoners mentioned as being held in Azkaban with Black.

3.description: One of the magical beds on the Knight Bus that slides around during the wild journey.

10.description: Magical map showing everyone's location at Hogwarts, created by James Potter and friends.

8.description: Goblin-like creatures that live in holes where blood has been spilled, discussed in DADA class.
One-legged creatures that lure travelers into bogs with their lanterns, covered in Lupin's class.

10.description: Assistant to Madam Rosmerta at the Three Broomsticks, helps serve customers.
One of the local magical residents of Hogsmeade village.

22.description: Ron's grandmother, mentioned in family discussions at end of term.

1.description: Magical letter that screams its message aloud, mentioned as punishment mail.

4.description: One of the older Gryffindor students who helps maintain house traditions and order.
One of the new first-year students sorted into Hufflepuff House.

8.description: Astronomy professor who teaches students about stars and planets from the Astronomy Tower.

6.description: Arithmancy professor, teaches the mathematical side of magic to advanced students.
Ancient Runes professor who teaches students to read and interpret magical symbols.

5.description: Hogwarts student in Harry's year, house unknown but present in shared classes.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year, intelligent and studious like most of her house.
Ravenclaw student known for her academic excellence and participation in class discussions.
Hufflepuff student in Harry's year, loyal and hardworking like his housemates.
Hufflepuff girl in Harry's year, friendly and helpful to her fellow students.

8.description: Wealthy witch mentioned as having had multiple husbands who died mysteriously, leaving her fortune.
Mischievous blue creatures mentioned in Defense Against the Dark Arts as previous year's chaos.

6.description: Small tree-dwelling creatures mentioned in Care of Magical Creatures class.

5.description: Magical railway employee who operates the Hogwarts Express train service.
Friendly witch who sells sweets and snacks on the Hogwarts Express train.

3.description: Witch who works at the Leaky Cauldron, serves drinks and meals to customers.
Shopkeeper who sells cauldrons and potion-making equipment in Diagon Alley.

4.description: Leader of the Headless Hunt, a group Nearly Headless Nick wants to join but can't due to his still-attached head.
One of many wizard portraits throughout Hogwarts who observe and comment on castle activities.
Magical device mentioned as detecting untrustworthy people and Dark Magic.

8.description: Historical wizard mentioned in History of Magic class, known for peculiar behavior.

1.description: Ministry employee whose job is to modify Muggle memories of magical incidents.

8.description: Neville's parents, mentioned as heroes who were tortured into insanity by Death Eaters.

10.description: Owner of Scrivenshaft's Quill Shop in Hogsmeade, sells writing supplies to students.
Proprietor of the magical equipment shop in Hogsmeade village.

4.description: Troll mentioned as part of Hogwarts' enhanced security measures during Black's escape period.

7.description: Wardrobe in the Defense classroom that contains a boggart for teaching purposes.

5.description: Supernatural frost that appears when Dementors are nearby, making everything cold and miserable.

22.description: Second eldest Weasley son mentioned as working with dragons in Romania.

4.description: Required textbook for Care of Magical Creatures that tries to bite anyone who opens it.

13.description: High-quality racing broomstick mentioned in Quidditch context.

4.description: One of the empty portrait frames throughout Hogwarts where portraits can visit and move between.
One of the many suits of armor that line Hogwarts corridors, some of which are enchanted to move.

1.description: Eccentric neighbor of the Dursleys who owns many cats, mentioned as Harry's occasional babysitter.

3.description: Mysterious Ministry employee from the Department of Mysteries, mentioned in connection with magical research.

6.description: Pure magical creature living in the Forbidden Forest, mentioned in Care of Magical Creatures.
Giant spider species mentioned as living in the Forbidden Forest, dangerous but intelligent.
Historical wizard mentioned in Transfiguration class as expert in Switching Spells.

17.description: Violent tree on Hogwarts grounds that attacks anything that comes near it, guards secret tunnel to Shrieking Shack.

6.description: Sir Cadogan's brave but sensible horse that often refuses his ridiculous orders.

4.description: Magical device that glows red when the holder has forgotten something, mentioned in passing.

3.description: Owner of the joke shop in Diagon Alley, competitor to Zonko's in Hogsmeade.

9.description: Patronus form mentioned in Lupin's lessons as example of different animal forms the charm can take.

13.description: Ravenclaw Quidditch Captain who leads his team against other houses.

4.description: Various ghosts who visit the Great Hall during meals and special occasions.
One of the many owls that live in the Owlery and deliver mail for students without pets.

1.description: Radio broadcaster on the Wizarding Wireless Network who announces news and programs.

5.description: Collectible card featuring a famous wizard that comes with Chocolate Frog sweets.

8.description: Exotic ingredient mentioned in Potions class as being difficult to obtain and expensive.

11.description: Magically enchanted cauldron that cleans itself after use, mentioned as luxury item.

6.description: Advanced textbook for Arithmancy class, full of complex magical calculations and formulas.
Textbook for Ancient Runes class containing magical symbols and their meanings.

13.description: Magical whistle used by Quidditch referees that can be heard over crowd noise and wind.

4.description: Magical fireworks that create spectacular displays and are popular with students for pranks.

recaps.1: Harry quietly struggles through homework late at night on his thirteenth birthday at the Dursleys. He learns via owl post that Sirius Black, a dangerous prisoner, has escaped Azkaban.
recaps.2: Harry accidentally inflates Aunt Marge in anger and panics. He flees Privet Drive after the accident.
recaps.3: Harry boards the Knight Bus and travels to the Leaky Cauldron in London. He meets Minister Fudge who warns him about Sirius Black.
recaps.4: Harry spends time at the Leaky Cauldron as the school year nears. He sees owls delivering mail and senses unease about Black's escape.
recaps.5: Dementors are stationed on the Hogwarts Express and Harry faints upon their approach. Professor Lupin intervenes to cast them away.
recaps.6: At Hogwarts, Lupin is introduced as the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher. Harry hears unsettling stories about Black.
recaps.7: Hagrid brings Buckbeak the hippogriff for class. Malfoy provokes Buckbeak and gets injured.
recaps.8: During Hagrid's defence, Filch mistakenly curses Buckbeak. Harry and Hermione plead for the creature's safety.
recaps.9: Dementors guard the school grounds and Harry continues to faint near them. Lupin offers to give Harry private lessons.
recaps.10: Harry begins Patronus Charm lessons with Lupin after experiencing more Dementor effects. He grows determined to learn the spell.
recaps.11: Fred and George gift Harry the Marauder's Map, revealing Hogwarts' secret passages. Harry discovers a hidden route into Hogsmeade.
recaps.12: Harry visits Hogsmeade via the secret tunnel and overhears a conversation that identifies Sirius Black as a betrayer. He learns Black was close to his parents.
recaps.13: Tension mounts at the castle as Sirius threatens the school. Harry remains unsettled by the looming danger.
recaps.14: Buckbeak is sentenced to execution after the hearing. Harry, Ron, and Hermione are distressed by the ruling.
recaps.15: Scabbers disappears from Ron's dormitory and Crookshanks appears agitated. Hermione suspects the cat is behind the rat's disappearance.
recaps.16: Ron is attacked and dragged into a tunnel under the Whomping Willow. Harry and Hermione follow to rescue him.
recaps.17: Harry and Hermione reach the Shrieking Shack and encounter a large black dog. Lupin arrives and confronts Sirius Black.
recaps.18: Truths emerge: Scabbers is revealed as Peter Pettigrew and Lupin is a werewolf. The group pieces together what happened twelve years ago.
recaps.19: Tensions escalate when Lupin transforms into a werewolf under the full moon. Pettigrew escapes and chaos ensues.
recaps.20: Harry and Hermione escape back to Hogwarts pursued by Dementors. Harry casts a Patronus to save them both.
recaps.21: Using the Time-Turner, Harry and Hermione travel back and rescue Buckbeak and Sirius before their executions. Events unfold from a second perspective.
recaps.22: Infirmary return: Lupin resigns, Black is held captive, and Hermione gives Harry a letter from Sirius. The school year ends quietly.
